wikipedia_page.main: Wayne Paul Foster (born 11 September 1963) is a former professional footballer who played as a striker in England and Scotland during the 1980s and 1990s.

response: *In the late 1990s, the club signed former Hearts pair Wayne Foster and George Wright, following the signing of former Hearts and Partick Thistle goalkeeper  John Brough earlier that decade.

link_mentions.page: Heart of Midlothian F.C. in European football

response: Jamieson won the Scottish First Division (second tier title) four times: with Hibs in 1980–81, with Hamilton Academical in 1985–86 and 1987–88 and with Dundee in 1991–92.Stars in Stripes, match programme, 1992, via Partick Thistle History Archive He was signed by Hearts in December 1994, transferring from Partick Thistle (where he had been club captain)Team Talk: Willie Jamieson, Partick Thistle Captain, match programme, August 1994, via Partick Thistle History Archive in exchange for Wayne Foster. He moved on to Ayr United where he added a Second Division (third tier) title to his medal collection in 1996–97.
